content: row the mouth about a stitch make sure the thread is higher than the corner of underneath where you the starting row are inserting your needle 3 pull tight so your 4 reinsert the needle in orangutang s smile the same stitch but make sure to go above the looks like this black thread of the smile 5 continue with the 6 continue with the same yarn to add the same yarn to add the nostrils the lower end of eyebrows as well these the nostrils is between are placed between row row 6 and 7 of the 11 and 12 of the head and mouth and the upper are about 7 sitches apart end is between row 7 they are each 3 stitches and 8 they are about 1 wide stitch apart and a little wider apart at the top © 2021 hb crafts all rights reserved this pattern is for personal use only 8 hannah bickerstaff - @hannahb_crafts adding the eye details use tapestry needle and some beige yarn 2 bring the yarn over the 1 insert your needle into top of the eye and from any spot near the reinsert the needle eye and bring it out between row 17 and 18 between row 15 and 16 do not let the beige as close to the inside of thread go underneath the eye bring the needle out the eye as possible again in the same spot as you inserted it in step 1 3 add a little fabric glue 4 repeat this 2 more to keep the yarn in the times each time laying right spot the yarn next to each other and continuing to use fabric glue 5 run the yarn along the bottom of the eye and insert the needle in the same stitch as you started adding 6 repeat the same fabric glue again to keep the process on the opposite yarn along the bottom edge eye of the eye then bring the yarn out in the same row on the inside of the opposite eye © 2021 hb crafts all rights reserved this pattern is for personal use only 9 hannah bickerstaff -
